This week I was lucky enough to experience the iconic New York autumn as I rolled into New York city
There's something magical about fall in Manhattan It's that sweet spot between the summer humidity and the icy winter when you can actually walk around town feel good and things don't smell so bad
It was late afternoon when I checked into my hotel and dropped off my bag New York is a great walking city and nothing encourages that more than a hotel room the size of a pine cone [noise]
The streets were colorful is always and Halloween has hit the city have you ever complimented someone's costume and realized he was just a New Yorker wears a milk carton
Is a hat [noise] I have [noise]
Walked into Washington Square park who sat on a bench near a dog run there's nothing crazier than in New York dog park
These are not dogs that are used to the freedom of back yards and rolling hills these are pets that have been locked indoors for hours drinking coffee trying not to be on the New York post
When they finally get to the dog park they lose their minds
I sat next to one of the dog owners musician named Dave even though he was in sweat pants has long hair and cool Jean jacket said he was a rocker his dog look cool to he was a mutt named Rocco with a spike the collar and an upper lip and permanent snarled Davis lived in the village
Been a permanent snarled Davis lived in the village with Rocco his whole adult life and makes a living now in the studio musician he was lamenting about how this city has changed there's no seemed pretty young bands any more so than New York used to be a city of artists weirdos who
Are too strange to live in their hometowns but now there's nothing left at the weirdos can afford
He said the one thing that will never change is the amazing diversity in the city there are people from all around the world he said just look at this dog park
